title: Procurement & Operations Specialist (Remote - New Opening)
description:
About COMSIS SOLUTIONS LLC




COMSIS Solutions is a U.S.-based company located in Alexandria, Virginia. Since 2014, we have been providing advanced technology, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, and logistics solutions. We work closely with U.S. Government agencies and ensure all our projects comply fully with FAR/DFARS regulations.

Our focus is on quality, compliance, on-time delivery, and transparency. COMSIS offers a professional and collaborative work environment that values integrity, teamwork, and growth. We provide excellent opportunities for learning, career development, and innovation.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated and independent Procurement & Operations Specialist to manage th e end-to-end procurement process for cur company. This role involves sourcing, negotiating, purchasing. vendor management, and resolving issues as they arise. You will work remotely and independently, often on-demand, to support different contracts and global supply chain need.

Duties & Responsibilities

Handle the complete procurement lifecycle from sourcing to purchasing.

Negotiate pricing, terms, and lead times with vendors and supplier.

Request and collect quotations from vendors via phone and email.

Place purchase orders and track deliveries.

Prepare and manage invoices, documentation, and compliance paperwork.

Resolve issues with vendors, logistics, or product availability.

Ensure timely procurement based on project deadlines.

Perform multitasking and versatile duties to support operations as needed.

Communicate directly with the management team regarding procurement status.

Maintain organized records of purchases, contracts, and supplier communications.

Job Requirements

Proven experience in procurement, purchasing, or vendor management.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Ability to negotiate effectively and close deals.

Must be highly independent, proactive, and able to work without supervision.

Flexible availability (not fixed to standard 9-5 hours).

Reliable laptop/computer and stable high-speed internet connection.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Fast learner with a problem-solving mindset.

Comfortable with remote work and taking full responsibility for tasks.

Fluent in English.

Knowledge and skills in IT to work with digital systems and toolsz.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field is required.

title: Datacom & IP Network Presales Specialist
description:
About AWAN Distribution FZC

Awan started in 2010, in Egypt and Pakistan as a philanthropic undertaking with a team of IT professionals recognizing the value of People as the key asset and ultimate objective of any enterprise.

Extending the same concept to the distribution arena, the same team, with a profound knowledge, establishes Awan distribution and understanding of what makes Distribution an added value in deeds & not just words.

Between them, the founding team members have decades of IT distribution knowledge and have already established more than ten full -fledged distribution subsidiaries.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Datacom & IP Network Presales Specialist to join our team at AWAN Distribution. As a key member of our presales department, you will be responsible for understanding customer requirements, designing innovative IP network solutions, and providing technical expertise and support throughout the presales process. You will collaborate closely with our sales team to deliver tailored solutions that meet our customers' needs and drive business growth.

Duties & Responsibilities

Collaborate with sales teams to identify customer requirements and propose customized IP network solutions.

· Conduct in-depth technical discussions and presentations to articulate the features and benefits of Huawei IP networking products and solutions.

· Design and architect IP network solutions based on customer needs, incorporating Huawei's cutting-edge technologies and best practices.

· Develop detailed network diagrams, proposals, and documentation to support presales activities.

· Perform product demonstrations and proof of concepts (PoCs) to showcase the capabilities of Huawei IP networking solutions.

· Provide technical support and guidance to customers during the evaluation and decision-making process.

· Collaborate with Huawei's product development and engineering teams to address customer feedback and enhance our IP networking offerings.

· Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to maintain a competitive edge in the market.




Skills

· Proven work experience in Datacom Presales

· Excellent technical skills

· Excellent written and spoken communication skills

· Strong problem-solving abilities

· The ability to work in a team

· Enthusiasm for your own professional development

Job Requirements

· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Master's degree preferred.

· 3+ years of experience in presales engineering, solution architecture, or network engineering roles, with a focus on IP networking.

· In-depth understanding of IP networking principles, protocols, and technologies, including routing, switching, security, and QoS.

· Hands-on experience with Huawei IP networking products and solutions is highly desirable.

· Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

· Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing customer challenges.

· Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines effectively.

· Industry certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, HCNP, or HCIE .

· Willingness to travel occasionally for customer meetings, workshops, and events.

Submission Guideline

Please submit your to the following email addresses:

To: ali.zafar@awandistribution.com

CC: Abdul.wahab@awandistribution.com




To facilitate the reviewer, please indicate the position title and vacancy number in the subject of the email. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

title: IT Officer /Technician
description:
About Sayara plus Technology Service

SAYARA Plus Technologies (SPT) is a National holding license in Afghanistan established in 2020.

SAYARA plus Technology provides a true and complete network solution for multiple end-users at an affordable,

Practical cost to our clients. These high-quality solutions range from basic ISP/ICT services to customized software and hardware development kits for various platforms.

SAYARA plus Technology is a legal operator in Afghanistan holding a valid business license from MOCI.

Our company was awarded a National ICT license by the Afghanistan Telecom Regulatory Authority (ATRA) - Ministry of Communication and Information Technology.

Job Summary

An ISP Technician is responsible for internet service installing, configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting internet and network services for residential and business customers. The role includes working with wireless point-to-point to ensure reliable connectivity, optimal performance, and high customer satisfaction. The technician diagnoses network issues, performs on-site and remote support, and follows safety and quality standards.

Duties & Responsibilities

Perform installation, activation, and troubleshooting of wireless links in accordance with company guidelines.
Installation and Troubleshooting of PTP, PTMP links (Ubnt and Mikrotik Devices)
Execute the installation, activation, and troubleshooting of microwave links following established protocols.
Install and configure LAN network devices to meet customer requirements effectively.
Troubleshoot LAN network devices and provide the best solution in case of the second option availability.
Conduct surveys for network projects, arrange requirements, and implement solutions as needed.
Installing Wire and Wireless equipment at Easy Connect wireless base stations and ensuring 100% functionality upon completion.
Integrating technical solutions successfully done on-site and sharing it with other team members for future use.
Design, install, configure, and maintain LAN, WAN, WLAN, and internet connectivity.
Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure maximum uptime.
Configure and manage routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers.
Implement network security measures, including VPNs, firewalls, and access controls.
Perform network upgrades, patches, and capacity planning.
Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity issues.
Maintain network documentation, diagrams, and standard operating procedures.
Collaborate with IT teams, vendors, and service providers.
Ensure compliance with security policies and best practices.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree/Diploma in Computer Science and/ or relevant field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in network installation and troubleshooting or a relevant field.
Knowledge and certification of CCNA and MTCNA is required.
strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate technical information effectively
Strong knowledge of TCP/IP, routing, switching, DNS, DHCP, and VLANs.
Hands-on experience with Cisco, MikroTik, or similar networking equipment.
Familiarity with network monitoring and troubleshooting tools.
Understanding of network security principles and protocols.
Knowledge of wireless technologies and network cabling

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Re - Announced)
description:
About Afghan Wireless Communication Company

Afghan Wireless is Afghanistan’s first wireless communications company. When we began operations in 2002, we founded Afghanistan’s mobile communications industry by being the first enterprise to offer cell phone service to Afghan consumers and businesses. For well over a decade, Afghan Wireless has driven the rapid growth of our nation’s communications market, through its innovative development and deployment of global-class High-Definition (HD) Voice Communications, Internet, Data and Mobile Payments Services. More than 6,000 people work for Afghan Wireless, and our Company is directly responsible for the creation of 100,000 jobs throughout Afghanistan.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Senior Full-Stack Developer with deep expertise in PHP/Laravel, Node.js, and Python to design, develop, and maintain large-scale telecom applications and subscriber-facing platforms. This role involves building high-performance backend systems, customer portals, internal operational tools, and integrating with a wide range of telecom network elements. The ideal candidate has experience working in a Mobile Network Operator (MNO) or large ISP environment, where reliability, security, scalability, and low latency are critical. 

Duties & Responsibilities

Design and develop systems such as SIM activation platforms, recharge/payment systems, VAS platforms, subscriber management tools, and operational dashboards.
Build APIs and services that integrate with core telecom systems such as HLR/HSS, OCS/IN, SMSC, PCRF, and provisioning systems. 
Build scalable backend applications using Laravel, Node.js, and Python.
Develop high-performance REST/GraphQL APIs and background workers.
Implement queue-based processing using RabbitMQ/Kafka/SQS.
Design database schemas optimized for telecom workloads.
Build dashboards, admin portals, and subscriber interfaces using React, Vue.js, or Next.js.
Implement real-time data interfaces using WebSockets/SSE. 
Integrate with telecom systems using REST, SOAP, SMPP, Diameter, and secured API gateways.
Work with both legacy and modern architecture.
Contribute to microservices design and high-availability distributed architectures.
Implement caching, sharding, throttling, and performance techniques.
Containerize and deploy applications using Docker and CI/CD pipelines.
Implement structured logging, tracing (OpenTelemetry), and metrics (Prometheus). 
Enforce secure coding practices (OWASP/CIS).
Ensure regulator-compliant audit trails and access control policies.
Mentor team members and perform code reviews.
Work closely with core network, BSS/OSS, NOC/SOC, and cybersecurity teams.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Telecom Engineering, or equivalent experience. (Master's degree will be preferred)
Must have 3 to 4 years relevant work experience (2 years’ experience for a master's degree).
Fluent in one of the local languages (Dari, Pashto) and English (written and spoken).
Strong expertise in PHP/Laravel, Node.js, and Python frameworks.
Frontend experience with React/Vue.js/Next.js.
Strong SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL) and Redis experience.
Experience building high-throughput, telecom-grade applications.
Knowledge of microservices, Docker, CI/CD, and secure API design. 
Experience with Kafka/RabbitMQ, SMPP, or CDR/billing systems.
Cloud experience (AWS/Azure/GCP).
Familiarity with TM Forum Open APIs. 
Strong work ethic, dependability, and the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a team to achieve goals and deliver high-quality results.
Ability to adapt to changing circumstances and lead the team through transitions and challenges effectively.
Understand the tools, equipment, and procedures specific to the job role.
Ability to work under pressure.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Able to travel to other provinces and work extra hours.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to address and resolve complex issues.
Follow the company's rules and policies.

Submission Guideline

Interested candidates should fill out and submit the APPLICATION FORM with complete and correct information. To have access to the APPLICATION FORM, please copy and paste the link into your Web Browser.




https://forms.gle/G8Rv7Lvrr7Es9ctJ9

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (Reannounced)
description:
About Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company

Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company is a full-fledged electronic money institution regulated by the central bank of Afghanistan operating under the license No. EMI101006. In addition to our regulatory license, we are also equipped with license No. 78895 from the Ministry of industry and commerce of Afghanistan. We possess advanced technology infrastructure which enables our clients to access financial services through their mobile phones securely, quickly and conveniently. Our services are available to everyone, particularly individuals who may not have access to traditional banking services. We offer significant opportunities for improving the efficiency of digital financial services by expanding access and lowering transaction costs. We provide a customized electronic payment solution. Aurum Afghanistan facilitates digital financial transactions, which includes services such as mobile wallet to mobile wallet, bank 02 to mobile wallet, mobile wallet to bank, electricity and other utilities bill payments, merchant’s payments, AfPay card services, payments through PoS machines and other prospective electronic payments services.

Job Summary

The Senior Full Stack Developer at AURUM is responsible for designing, building, and launching software, FinTech solutions, and API integrations. This person leads the Innovation and Development Unit and works to connect AURUM’s systems with third-party services like mobile operators, e-money providers and digital wallets. The role focuses on creating secure, scalable, and easy-to-use digital services that support AURUM’s digital goals and customer needs.

Duties & Responsibilities

1. Digital Innovation & Product Development

Manage internal FinTech projects like mobile apps, websites, digital wallets, and automation tools.
Suggest and test new features to improve service quality and user experience.

2. Software Development & Quality Control

Oversee the complete software development process using tools:
Frontend: Angular, or React.
Backend: Java, Spring Boot and relevant libraries
Ensure all software meets high standards for security, performance, and compliance.
Supervise testing (UAT), system launches, and update schedules.

·      Design and optimize databases (Oracle) to support applications and ensure data integrity.

·      Write efficient queries and manage database migrations.

·      Ensure the ongoing development and enhancement of the existing AurumPay Mobile Money system.

3. API Development & Third-Party Integration

Lead the creation of APIs (REST and SOAP) for both internal and external use.
Manage connections with mobile operators, digital wallets, EMIs, and external service providers.
Maintain proper documentation and manage the full API lifecycle.

4. System Design & Infrastructure Planning

Design technical systems and integration plans based on business needs.
Work with teams across the organization to build scalable, efficient solutions.
Ensure all systems connect properly with payment switches and gateways.

5. Team Leadership & Technical Support

Understand the needs of different departments and offer secure, reliable solutions.
Provide training and guidance to technical team members.
Promote and enforce agile development methods across the team.




Job Requirements

Strong knowledge of programming languages: Java, Spring Boot and relevant framework and libraries.
Experience designing system architecture and working with APIs (REST/SOAP) and third-party services.
Familiar with microservices and the full software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Hands-on experience integrating with wallets, telecom operators, EMIs, and financial switches.
Comfortable working with Oracle databases.
Responsible for deploying applications on Oracle WebLogic Server
Skilled in using version control tools such as GitHub and GitLab.
Good documentation and presentation skills.
Able to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities.
At least 2 years of experience in FinTech, software development, or technical integration.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Familiarity with mobile app development using Flutter or React Native is a plus

title: Web Application Developer
description:
About Afghanistan International Bank

From its inception in 2004, AIB’s mission has been to foster economic development in the country, be a catalyst for growth, and ultimately contribute to the prosperity of Afghanistan and its people. Afghanistan International Bank is the country’s leading bank, and one of the most trusted and respected institutions in Afghanistan. Our success has been enabled by our unwavering focus on international best practices in corporate governance, financial, and risk management - including anti-money laundering and ‘know your customer’ procedures. This is overlaid by industry-leading customer service, operations, information technology, and internal controls. Despite the challenging backdrop over the last decade, we have successfully become a positive emblem for achievement, governance, and transformation. Now in our second decade of operation, we remain committed to enabling a better future for Afghanistan and we are proud to play a role in shaping the opportunities that lie ahead. AIB believes in developing its people through continuous investment in training and giving larger opportunities to those who grow with the bank. With professional management team, ensuring high standards of corporate governance and a professional work environment where every manager is committed to train and develop his people is what makes AIB an employer of choice.

Job Summary

A Web Application Officer is responsible for developing, maintaining, securing, and optimizing web-based applications and websites to ensure high performance, functionality, and user engagement. They bridge the gap between technical requirements and user needs, implementing server-side logic, managing databases, and ensuring seamless cross-platform compatibility. 

Duties & Responsibilities

Develop internal applications and system enhancements
Build APIs, web systems, and database structures
Participate in testing, deployment, and documentation
Develop AI/ML models, dashboards, and prediction tools
Integrate AI modules with banking applications and data pipelines.
Create automation bots (RPA), scripts, and workflows
Analyze business processes for automation opportunities
Maintain AI model lifecycle and monitoring
Ensure scalability, performance, and security of developed applications.
Collaborate with business units to gather requirements and deliver solutions.
Architect, design, and implement scalable AI/ML computing infrastructures and application stacks
Collaborate with business team to design and deploy AI solutions.
Develop and demonstrate AI use-cases, conducting workshops and training sessions to foster AI adoption.
Evaluate and implement best practices in AI/ML, data mining, and analytics.
Document architecture roadmaps, reference architectures, and standard operating procedures for AI solutions.
Provide expert consultation on AI-related standards and best practices.
Stay updated with emerging technologies in AI and ML to enhance institutional capabilities.
 Develop and implement AI models. Design machine learning models and algorithms to solve problems and enhance functionality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams. Work with data scientists, stakeholders, and product managers to build and deploy AI solutions.
Conduct data analysis. Analyze large data sets to identify patterns and insights that inform AI development.
Prototyping and testing. Create prototypes to test AI applications and refine machine learning techniques.
Maintain AI pipelines. Develop and maintain pipelines for deploying AI models into production environments.
Stay updated on advancements. Research and implement the latest advancements in AI and machine learning frameworks.
Integrate AI solutions. Implement AI into existing software systems to enhance functionality and user experience.
Any other assignment as given by the line manager. 

Job Requirements

EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:




Minimum Bachelor Degree in the Computer Science or related field, priority will be given for master degree holder.
IT related certificates.




RELEVANT EXPERIENCE:
At least two years related experience or three years IT experience in banking.
Familiar with banking software
Familiar with Artificial Intelligence (AI).
Software Development.




SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: 
         
Excellent Written and Verbal Communication
Interpersonal Communication
Familiar with API concepts (Restful) and system integration
Good concepts of SDLC lifecycle process
Familiarity with AI models is must
Capacity of adopting AI models into business processes specially banking applications (like mobile applications, wallet, ...)
Consider scalability, performance, and security in application developing process.
Understand Principals of Network concepts
Deep understanding of web application technologies.
Good understanding of database systems (SQL server and Oracle)
Good understanding of IT security principals
Familiar with .NET core is advantage
Problem solving, Team Culture.

Submission Guideline

AIB is committed to a diverse workforce and encourage all eligible local applicants, irrespective of gender, disability, culture, religious and ethnic backgrounds to apply.

 

Interested individuals can apply using the below link:

 

https://aib.zohorecruit.com/jobs/Careers/584743000007112168/Web-Application-Developer?source=CareerSite

title: Network Engineer
description:
About Yama Ramin Media production & Technology

Yama Ramin Media Production and Technology Company (YRMPT) is a well-established media production and technology company, officially registered with the Ministry of Commerce and Industries of Afghanistan. With a strong presence across the country, YRMPT delivers innovative media and technology solutions in collaboration with a diverse range of national and international organizations.

We work closely with leading telecom operators, as well as international NGOs, development partners, and humanitarian organizations, and various United Nations agencies. Our projects span media production, digital solutions, communication campaigns, and technology-driven services, contributing to impactful and sustainable initiatives nationwide.

At YRMPT, we value professionalism, creativity, innovation, and teamwork. We provide a dynamic working environment that encourages learning, skill development, and growth, while offering opportunities to work on high-impact projects with reputable local and international partners.

For more information about our company, services, and portfolio, please visit www.yrmpt.com.




Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled Network Engineer to design, implement, manage, and maintain our organization’s network infrastructure. The ideal candidate will ensure reliable, secure, and high-performance network connectivity to support business operations.

Duties & Responsibilities

Design, install, configure, and maintain LAN, WAN, WLAN, and internet connectivity
Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure maximum uptime
Configure and manage routers, switches, firewalls, and load balancers
Implement network security measures, including VPNs, firewalls, and access controls
Perform network upgrades, patches, and capacity planning
Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity issues
Maintain network documentation, diagrams, and standard operating procedures
Collaborate with IT teams, vendors, and service providers
Ensure compliance with security policies and best practices




Job Requirements

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience 2-3 years as a Network Engineer or similar role
Strong knowledge of TCP/IP, routing, switching, DNS, DHCP, and VLANs
Hands-on experience with Cisco, MikroTik, or similar networking equipment
Familiarity with network monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Understanding of network security principles and protocols
Knowledge of wireless technologies and network cabling

Preferred Skills & Certifications

CCNA / CCNP or equivalent certifications is a plus
Knowledge of server side administration and deployment (Windows Server, Linux)
Experience with cloud networking (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Soft Skills

Excellent communication and documentation skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong time-management and multitasking abilities
Willingness to work on-call or outside normal business hours if required.




Submission Guideline

Interested Afghan candidates with the required qualification and experience should submit their applications electronically through hr@yrmpt.com email. To avoid confusions, disagreement and conflicts during recruitment process all applicants are required to clearly mention position title (Network Engineer) and vacancy announcement number (YRMPT-HR-069) in the subject lines of their emails. otherwise, their CV's will not be considered for this post.

title: Digital Financial Services (DFS) Trainer
description:
About Behtar LTD (Behtar Group)

Behtar is a group of companies that has been at the forefront of the telecommunications, mobile money, and e-commerce sectors for 20 years. The company was founded with the vision of connecting people and businesses, and facilitating commerce in an increasingly connected world. Through the years, Behtar has grown to become a leading provider of telecommunications, mobile money, and e-commerce services in Afghanistan, with a strong reputation for innovation and customer service. Started as a small telecom service provider and quickly recognized the potential for growth and expansion in the financial services sector. we worked hard to provide innovative and cutting-edge solutions that could improve the lives of our customers. We were the first to offer high-speed internet and mobile banking services in our country, and as a result, we rapidly grew our customer base. With the passage of time, we continued to adapt and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers, always looking for ways to push the boundaries of what was possible.

Today, the Behtar group of companies is a well-established and respected player in both the telecom and financial services sectors, known for our commitment to excellence and our ability to deliver results. We are excited to continue growing and serving our customers for many years to come.

Job Summary

The Digital Financial Services (DFS) Trainer will be responsible for designing and delivering structured capacity-building programs across Behtar Group’s operational footprint. The role focuses on strengthening agent, merchant, and customer onboarding; improving field performance; and ensuring strict compliance with EMI, telecom, and partner regulatory frameworks. The DFS Trainer will also lead market activation initiatives through workshops and seminars targeting local traders and SMEs to drive adoption and usage of Behtar Group’s digital financial services. 

Duties & Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement DFS training curricula covering:

Agent and merchant onboarding processes
Customer acquisition and lifecycle management
Float management, transaction workflows, and reconciliation
Performance management and KPI tracking

Deliver classroom, workshop, and field-based trainings for:

Internal staff
Agents and sub-agents
Merchants, shopkeepers, and local traders

Conduct capacity-building sessions at Behtar Group facilities and regional locations through structured workshops and seminars.

Ensure all trainings align with:

EMI operational policies
Telecom and mobile money regulations
Partner banks, MNOs, and third-party compliance requirements

Train field teams and customers on:

KYC, AML/CFT, consumer protection, and fraud prevention
Data security, transaction integrity, and operational risk controls

Support agent and merchant performance optimization through refresher trainings and coaching programs.

Coordinate with Operations, Compliance, Risk, and Business Development teams to ensure consistent messaging and operational adherence.

Prepare training materials, SOPs, user guides, and assessment tools using industry best practices.

Monitor training effectiveness and provide reports with recommendations for continuous improvement.

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, ICT, Telecommunications, or a related field.

Minimum 3–5 years of experience in:

Digital Financial Services
EMI, mobile money, or telecom value-added services
Training, capacity building, or field operations

Strong understanding of:

Agent and merchant network management
Mobile money ecosystems and DFS products
Regulatory compliance within EMI and telecom environments

Proven experience delivering training to diverse audiences, including low-literacy market segments.

Excellent communication, facilitation, and stakeholder engagement skills.

Willingness to travel extensively to regional and provincial locations.




Preferred Competencies

Experience working with banks, MNOs, and international development or financial inclusion programs
Strong presentation and instructional design skills
Fluency in local languages and English (written and spoken)

title: IT/ System Manager
description:
About Park View Hotel Service

Park View Hotel Services is a professionally managed hospitality organization committed to delivering high-quality accommodation and exceptional guest services. The hotel operates with a strong focus on service excellence, comfort, and operational efficiency. Through well-maintained facilities, qualified staff, and customer-oriented standards, Park View Hotel Services aims to provide a refined and reliable experience for both business and leisure guests.

Job Summary

The IT / System Manager is responsible for managing, maintaining, and securing all IT systems and technological infrastructure of the hotel. This role ensures the smooth operation of hotel management systems, networks, hardware, and software to support daily operations and enhance guest experience.




Duties & Responsibilities

IT Systems & Infrastructure

Manage and maintain hotel IT systems including PMS (Property Management System), POS, and reservation systems
Ensure smooth operation of computer systems, servers, networks, and internet connectivity
Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software

 

Network & Security

Monitor network performance and ensure data security
Implement IT security policies, backups, and disaster recovery plans
Protect hotel systems from cyber threats and unauthorized access

Support & Troubleshooting

Provide technical support to hotel staff across departments
Troubleshoot system errors, hardware failures, and software issues
Coordinate with external IT vendors and service providers

title: Procurement & Project Solutions Specialist (COO Support | Remote | High-Responsiveness / On-Call)
description:
About VASTGLOBE LOGISTICS LLC

VastGlobe Logistics LLC is a procurement and logistics company that sources and delivers equipment worldwide. We handle the full process, from identifying the right products and securing pricing to documentation, order tracking, and final delivery.




Job Summary

We’re looking for a highly dedicated, full-scope operations + procurement all-rounder who can support the COO and keep projects moving end-to-end.




1) Online Purchasing + Procurement Execution
Purchase project requirements online (fast + accurate).
Negotiate discounts with vendors (high sales/closing mindset).
Handle tax-exempt purchasing when applicable (collect docs, apply exemption, track status).
Track each purchase from quote → order → delivery → invoice → payment status.
Maintain clean records (POs, invoices, receipts, tracking numbers, vendor notes).
2) Discount & Vendor Negotiation (Sales Skills)
Call/email vendors to secure better pricing, faster lead times, and improved terms.
Follow up aggressively and professionally until results are delivered.
3) Project Problem-Solving + Updates
When a project has a problem, you find solutions (research + vendor coordination + internal coordination).
Provide periodic project updates (status, risks, next steps, blockers, resolution plan).
4) COO Assistant (High Research / Due Diligence)
Handle tasks assigned by the COO with strong research, critical thinking, and attention to detail.
Support decision-making with clear findings and recommendations.

5) Payroll & Monthly Employee Reporting.




Work Style Requirements
Fluent English (10/10) spoken and written.
Extremely organized, fast learner, proactive, and accountable.
Highly responsive and available for urgent items when needed (projects can be time-sensitive).







Duties & Responsibilities

Execute end-to-end online purchasing for active projects (quote → discount → order → tracking → delivery confirmation → invoice filing).

Proactively negotiate vendor discounts via email/phone (pricing, lead time, terms) and follow up until confirmed in writing.

Manage tax-exempt purchasing workflows when applicable (collect exemption docs, submit to vendors, verify tax removal, keep records).

Maintain accurate project purchasing trackers (vendor, item, price, ETA, tracking number, invoice status, issues/notes).

Verify purchase details before ordering (specs, quantities, ship-to, compliance requirements) to avoid errors and delays.

Collect and organize all procurement documentation (quotes, invoices, receipts, packing lists, PODs) in structured folders.

Act as the project problem-solver: identify issues, research solutions, contact vendors/partners, and propose the best fix.

Provide periodic project updates (status, blockers, risks, mitigation plan, next steps) to the COO.

Coordinate with internal team members and vendors to keep each project moving and close out tasks on time.

Prepare monthly employee attendance/salary support reports (days worked, off days, performance/output summary).

Support COO with due diligence and research tasks (vendor research, product alternatives, market pricing, compliance checks).

Maintain strict confidentiality, professionalism, and rapid response for time-sensitive requests.

Job Requirements

Must-Have
Proven experience in procurement / purchasing (online purchasing, vendor coordination, quotes, invoices, order tracking).
Strong ability to solve project problems independently (critical thinking + high ownership).
Excellent vendor negotiation skills (comfortable calling vendors, pushing for discounts, documenting results).
Fluent English (10/10) written and spoken (must communicate clearly with U.S. vendors and clients).
Strong organization and reporting skills (trackers, folders, documentation discipline, monthly reporting).
Reliable home computer setup + stable 24/7 internet access.
High responsiveness, accountability, and ability to work under pressure with deadlines.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects at once.
Preferred
Bachelor’s degree (CS preferred) or equivalent experience demonstrating strong analytical skills.
Experience supporting an executive/COO directly.
Familiarity with tools like Google Sheets/Excel, Google Drive, Slack, Trello/Asana/ClickUp.
Experience handling tax exemption certificates and vendor onboarding processes.
Prior experience in logistics/procurement for government or B2B projects is a plus.




Submission Guideline

Please submit a 3-minute video by uploading it to Google Drive and sharing access with ksafi@comsissolutions.com

. Make sure you provide the Google Drive link and grant viewing permission.

In the video, please explain your background in English and confirm that you have 24/7 internet access and a home computer setup. Also, let us know if you are currently working anywhere else.

title: IT Security Analyst
description:
About Ghazanfar Bank

Ghazanfar Bank, a full-fledged licensed commercial Bank, commenced its operations in March 2009. The Share Holders of the Bank belongs to one of the leading business groups of Afghanistan. As a leading business house Ghazanfar Group is involved in various key businesses sectors as a front runner such as import and distribution of Petroleum/Gas and other various important industrial sectors. Ghazanfar Bank started its operation in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is offering key financial services both under conventional and Islamic Banking. The Bank has since opened up its Branches at various key locations such as Mazar Sharif, Hairatan, Nayeb Abad Branch Kunduz, Takhar, Pule- Khumri, Jalalabad, Herat & Kandahar besides opening another eight branches at Kabul in Sarai Shahzada, Shar-e-Naw, Karte Naw, Kote Sangi, Lase Maryam, Karte Char, Kabul Airport Branch and Wazir Akbar Khan. In due course of time, the Bank intends to expand its Branch Network in Kabul as well as at other key locations of the Country.

Job Summary

The IT Security Analyst is responsible for protecting the Bank’s information assets, systems, and infrastructure by implementing, monitoring, and enhancing information security controls. The role ensures that cybersecurity risks are effectively identified, managed, and escalated in line with Basel principles, regulatory requirements, and the Bank’s risk appetite.

The position supports operational IT security under the Dy-CIO while ensuring indepndent risk oversight and incident escalation to the CRO

Duties & Responsibilities

A. Information Security Operations

Monitor IT systems, networks, and applications for security threats and vulnerabilities.
Implement and maintain security controls, tools, and configurations.
Support secure system configurations across CBS, applications, servers, and networks.
Ensure compliance with approved IT security standards and policies.




B. Cyber Risk & Incident Management

Detect, analyze, and respond to information security incidents and cyber threats.
Escalate material security incidents, cyber risks, and control weaknesses to the CRO in a timely manner.
Support incident investigation, root-cause analysis, and remediation actions.
Maintain incident logs and prepare incident reports.




C. Governance, Risk & Compliance Support

Support the implementation of the Bank’s Information Security Policy, IT governance framework, and risk controls.
Coordinate with Risk Management to:
Identify IT and cyber risks
Support risk assessments and KRIs
Align controls with the Bank’s risk appetite
Support Compliance requirements related to data protection, access controls, and regulatory expectations.




D. Access Control & Security Monitoring

Monitor and review user access rights to critical systems (including CBS).
Support periodic access reviews and segregation of duties controls.
Ensure timely removal or modification of access for staff movements and terminations.




E. Vulnerability Management & Security Testing

Conduct or coordinate vulnerability assessments and security testing.
Track remediation of identified vulnerabilities.
Support implementation of security patches and system hardening.




F. Audit & Regulatory Support

Act as a focal point for IT security matters during:
Internal Audit
External Audit
Regulatory examinations
Support closure of IT security-related audit findings and regulatory observations.




G. Awareness & Capacity Building

Support IT security awareness initiatives and training programs for staff.
Promote a strong security culture and compliance with security policies.




7. Authority & Escalation

Recommend security improvements and corrective actions.
Escalate high-risk security incidents and systemic weaknesses to Dy-CIO and CRO.
No authority to override business or system decisions without approval.




Job Requirements

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related field.

Professional Certifications (Preferred)

CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH, ISO 27001, or equivalent information security certifications.

Experience

Minimum 3–5 years of experience in IT security, cybersecurity, or information risk management.
Experience in banking, financial services, or regulated environments is a strong advantage.




Submission Guideline

Submission guidelines

Applicants who meet the above requirements should submit their updated Curriculum vitae (CV)/Resume to (sr.recruitment-officer@ghazanfarbank.com)

Please Mention specific Job Title in subject of your E-mail otherwise your Email will not be considered.

Ghazanfar Bank, a full-fledged licensed commercial Bank, commenced its operations in March 2009. The Share Holders of the Bank belongs to one of the leading business groups of Afghanistan. As a leading business house Ghazanfar Group is involved in various key businesses sectors as a front runner such as import and distribution of Petroleum/Gas and other various important industrial sectors. Ghazanfar Bank started its operation in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is offering key financial services both under conventional and Islamic Banking. The Bank has since opened up its Branches at various key locations such as Mazar Sharif, Hairatan, Nayeb Abad Branch Kunduz, Takhar, Pule- Khumri, Jalalabad, Herat & Kandahar besides opening another eight branches at Kabul in Sarai Shahzada, Shar-e-Naw, Karte Naw, Kote Sangi, Lase Maryam, Karte Char, Kabul Airport Branch and Wazir Akbar Khan. In due course of time, the Bank intends to expand its Branch Network in Kabul as well as at other key locations of the Country




Job Summary

The Treasury Governance & Systems Manager is a senior, highly specialized role responsible for establishing, strengthening, and continuously enhancing the governance framework, systems architecture, internal controls, and operational protocols of the Treasury Department. The position plays a foundational and transformational role in ensuring that Treasury operations are robust, well-controlled, system-driven, regulator-compliant, and aligned with international best practices.




Duties & Responsibilities

A. Treasury Governance & Control Framework

Design, review, and continuously enhance the Treasury Governance Framework, including:
Delegation of authority
Maker–checker controls
Segregation of duties
Escalation and approval hierarchies
Ensure treasury activities are fully aligned with:
Da Afghanistan Bank regulations
Basel principles
Internal risk appetite and governance standards
Support the Treasury Manager in maintaining a strong control culture within treasury operations.

B. Treasury Systems Ownership & Oversight

Act as the primary governance and control owner of treasury-related systems, including:
Treasury modules in CBS
Liquidity management systems
FX, money market, and investment tracking tools
Ensure treasury systems:
Are properly configured
Reflect approved products and limits
Are consistent with accounting and risk frameworks
Coordinate with IT & CBS to manage:
System changes
Parameter updates
Access rights
Release controls

C. Treasury Process Design & Re-Engineering

Build, rebuild, or redesign treasury processes covering:

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
About Ghazanfar Pay

Ghazanfar Pay is establish as a newly Electronic Money Institution (EMI) and a proud subsidiary of Ghazanfar Bank, one of Afghanistan’s leading and most trusted financial institutions, built on a vision to revolutionize the way people transfer and manage money, Ghazanfar Pay aims to become the leading digital financial services provider in Afghanistan and the region. The company is committed to financial inclusion, bringing secure, affordable, and innovative electronic payment solutions to individuals, businesses, and communities. As a forward-looking financial technology company, Ghazanfar Pay will play a vital role in driving digital transformation in Afghanistan’s financial sector, promoting trust, transparency, and accessibility for all.

Job Summary

The CTO is responsible for defining and executing Ghazanfar Pay’s overall technology vision and architecture. This includes oversight of the EMI platform, mobile applications, switching and integration layers, cybersecurity frameworks, data management, and technology operations. The CTO will ensure that Ghazanfar Pay’s technology infrastructure is secure, scalable, interoperable, and compliant with EMI regulations and industry best practices. The role is critical in enabling product innovation, transaction reliability, operational resilience, and business continuity in a fragile and high-risk operating environment.

Duties & Responsibilities

Technology Strategy & Architecture

Develop and execute the overall technology strategy aligned with Ghazanfar Pay’s business objectives and regulatory requirements.
Design and maintain enterprise architecture covering Ghazanfar pay platforms, mobile applications, middleware, switching, APIs, and data layers.
Ensure scalability, modularity, and high availability of all technology systems.
Lead technology roadmaps for new product enablement, system upgrades, and digital transformation initiatives.
Ensure interoperability with national payment systems, APS, switches, telecom partners, and banking platforms.
Establish technology governance frameworks, standards, and documentation.

Core Platforms & Application Management

Oversee implementation, configuration, and lifecycle management of Ghazanfar pay systems, wallet platforms, and transaction engines.
Ensure stability, performance, and resilience of mobile apps, portals, and backend services.
Lead integration of merchant systems, agent platforms, billers, and third-party fintech solutions.
Manage change management, version upgrades, and release cycles.
Ensure strong QA, UAT, and production deployment processes.
Support rapid and secure rollout of new digital products and features.

Cybersecurity, Infrastructure & Data Protection

Establish and enforce comprehensive cybersecurity frameworks aligned with regulatory and international standards.
Oversee security architecture, access controls, encryption, network protection, and endpoint security.
Lead implementation of SOC monitoring, vulnerability management, and incident response mechanisms.
Ensure compliance with data protection, privacy, and consumer information security requirements.
Conduct regular penetration testing, system audits, and disaster recovery drills.
Develop and maintain business continuity and disaster recovery systems.

Systems Operations & Reliability

Ensure 24/7 system availability, monitoring, and performance optimization.
Oversee transaction processing efficiency, uptime management, and system health dashboards.
Establish SLAs and performance frameworks for internal systems and third-party vendors.
Implement automated monitoring, alerting, and failover mechanisms.
Lead root cause analysis and continuous system improvement initiatives.
Ensure operational readiness for high transaction volumes and national-scale services.

Vendor, Integration & Innovation Management

Lead technology vendor selection, contracting, performance monitoring, and risk assessments.
Manage system integrators, cloud/service providers, telecom partners, and fintech collaborators.
Oversee API ecosystems and secure partner connectivity frameworks.
Identify emerging technologies to enhance efficiency, security, and service delivery.
Promote innovation in payments, AI-enabled operations, digital identity, and analytics.
Ensure cost-effective, future-proof technology investments.

Regulatory, Risk & Compliance Enablement

Work closely with Compliance, Risk, and Internal Audit to embed regulatory controls into system design.
Ensure platforms support AML/CFT monitoring, transaction surveillance, and regulatory reporting.
Facilitate system readiness for Central Bank inspections and audits.
Maintain documentation of system controls, data flows, and security governance.
Ensure traceability, audit logs, and regulatory reporting capabilities are fully embedded.

Data, Analytics & Digital Enablement

Lead data architecture, warehousing, and analytics platforms.
Enable real-time dashboards for management, operations, compliance, and risk monitoring.
Promote data-driven decision-making and customer insight capabilities.
Oversee AI, automation, and digital optimization initiatives.
Ensure data quality, availability, and integrity across systems.

People, Capability & Performance Management

Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing technology and digital team.
Establish continuous learning and certification programs.
Define clear KPIs, performance dashboards, and service accountability frameworks.
Promote a culture of innovation, resilience, cybersecurity awareness, and operational discipline.
Ensure succession planning and local capacity development.
Enforce ethical, professional, and secure technology practices.

Job Requirements

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (Master’s preferred).
Professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, TOGAF, ITIL, or cloud/security certifications highly desirable.

Experience

Minimum 8–10 years of experience in technology leadership roles within EMI, fintech, telecom, banking, or payment services.
At least 3–5 years in a senior management or CTO/Head of Technology role.
Proven experience implementing large-scale digital payment platforms and high-availability systems.
Strong expertise in cybersecurity, systems integration, APIs, and payment switching.
Demonstrated experience working with regulators, audits, and compliance-driven environments.
Strong understanding of mobile money ecosystems, EMI platforms, and digital financial infrastructure.
Experience in emerging markets or fragile operating environments preferred.
Fluency in English required; local languages an asset.
Experience supporting humanitarian or large-scale digital payment programs is a strong advantage.

Key Competencies

Strategic technology leadership and execution capability.
Strong systems architecture and cybersecurity expertise.
Operational resilience and crisis management skills.
Innovation mindset with strong delivery discipline.
Vendor and stakeholder management capability.
High integrity, accountability, and regulatory awareness.
Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to operate in high-risk, fast-changing environments.
Expertise in interoperability and national payment infrastructure.
Commitment to building sustainable local technology capacity.

Submission Guideline

title: Sharia Audit Officer
description:
About Ghazanfar Bank

Ghazanfar Bank, a full-fledged licensed commercial Bank, commenced its operations in March 2009. The Share Holders of the Bank belongs to one of the leading business groups of Afghanistan. As a leading business house Ghazanfar Group is involved in various key businesses sectors as a front runner such as import and distribution of Petroleum/Gas and other various important industrial sectors. Ghazanfar Bank started its operation in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is offering key financial services both under conventional and Islamic Banking. The Bank has since opened up its Branches at various key locations such as Mazar Sharif, Hairatan, Nayeb Abad Branch, Kunduz, Takhar, Pule- Khumri, Jalalabad, Herat, Kandahar, Faryab besides opening another Nine branches at Kabul in Sarai Shahzada, Shar-e-Naw, Karte Naw, Kote Sangi, Lase Maryam, Karte Char, Kabul Airport Branch and Wazir Akbar Khan. In due course of time, the Bank intends to expand its Branch Network in Kabul as well as at other key locations of the Country.

 

Job Summary

The Sharia Audit Officer is responsible for conducting periodic Sharia audits across the bank to ensure all products, services, contracts, transactions, and operational processes fully comply with Islamic Sharia principles and the rulings of the Sharia Supervisory Board. The role helps preserve the bank’s Islamic integrity and strengthens governance.

Duties & Responsibilities

1. Sharia Audit Planning & Execution

Participate in preparing the annual Sharia Audit Plan based on risk assessment.
Conduct field audits in branches and departments to verify adherence to Sharia guidelines.
Examine financing files, contracts, documentation, and transaction flows for Sharia compliance.
Test samples of Murabaha, Ijara, Musharaka, Mudaraba, and deposit transactions against Sharia standards.

2. Review of Contracts, Policies & Procedures

Audit the implementation of Sharia-approved product structures and documentation.
Ensure operational procedures match the product manuals approved by the Sharia Supervisory Board (SSB).
Check whether staff are following required Sharia workflows (e.g., asset ownership, agency structures, disclosures, penalties handling).

3. Identification of Sharia Non-Compliance

Identify Sharia violations, deviations, or gaps during audits.
Discuss findings with relevant departments and agree on corrective actions.
Ensure non-compliance events are recorded, reported, and resolved within the required timeframe.

4. Reporting & Documentation

Prepare clear Sharia audit reports with observations, recommendations, and compliance ratings.
Submit audit results to the Head of Sharia Audit and contribute to reports for the Sharia Supervisory Board.
Maintain proper documentation of all audit working papers and evidence.

5. Follow-Up & Corrective Actions

Follow up on previously reported Sharia findings to verify whether corrective actions were implemented.
Work with business units, risk management, operations, and compliance teams to close audit issues.

6. Coordination & Support

Coordinate with Internal Audit and Compliance Department for combined risk reviews.
Provide Sharia guidance to departments during audits to improve their understanding and performance.

7. Capacity Building & Awareness

Support the development of Sharia audit tools, checklists, and audit methodologies.
Assist in internal awareness sessions on Sharia compliance requirements for staff.

8. Continuous Improvement

Stay updated on AAOIFI Sharia standards, new fatwas, and industry best practices.

. Recommend improvements to Sharia audit processes and internal controls

Job Requirements

Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Islamic Studies, Sharia, Islamic Finance, Accounting, or Business Administration.
Professional certification in Islamic finance or Sharia audit (preferred).
1–3 years of experience in Islamic banking, Sharia audit, internal audit, or compliance roles.
Familiarity with AAOIFI standards and Islamic banking products.

Skills & Competencies

Strong understanding of Islamic banking and Sharia principles.
Ability to analyze financial transactions and documentation.
Good report writing skills with clarity and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail and analytical mindset.
Excellent communication and coordination abilities.
High integrity, objectivity, and professionalism.




Submission Guideline

Applicants who meet the above requirements should submit their updated Curriculum vitae (CV)/Resume to (sr.recruitment-officer@ghazanfarbank.com)

Please Mention specific Job Title in subject of your E-mail otherwise your Email will not be considered.

description:
About Ghazanfar Bank

Ghazanfar Bank, a full-fledged licensed commercial Bank, commenced its operations in March 2009. The Share Holders of the Bank belongs to one of the leading business groups of Afghanistan. As a leading business house Ghazanfar Group is involved in various key businesses sectors as a front runner such as import and distribution of Petroleum/Gas and other various important industrial sectors. Ghazanfar Bank started its operation in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is offering key financial services both under conventional and Islamic Banking. Job Summary

We are looking for a skilled IT Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining the company’s IT infrastructure, ensuring smooth operation of hardware, software, and network systems. You will be tasked with troubleshooting technical issues, providing support to staff, and ensuring that all IT equipment is functioning efficiently. The IT Technician will also assist in setting up new technology, maintaining system security, and implementing best practices for IT management. 

Duties & Responsibilities

1.   Be able to do Installation of Operating System Windows and Microsoft Office.

2.   Periodically report to line manager

3.   Be able to identify and fix network, camera and sound system connector related issues.

4.   Check, Analyze, Troubleshoot and resolve common and major technical issues of below related IT equipment:

·   Computer CPU

·   Monitors

·   Keyboard and Mouse

·   UPS

·  Printer (Dot Matrix, LaserJet, Ink-Jet, Card Printer)

·   Copier Machines

·   Money Counter Machines

·   Scanners

·   Paper Shredder

·   Security Camera

·   Microphones and Head Phones

·   Power Adapters

·   And any other IT electronic devices.

5.   Service and Cleaning of above-mentioned devices when and as needed to mitigate possible damages.

6.   Service Printers and Copier Machines at least once in 6 Months

7.   Cooperate and work with Network and CCTV team with Network and CCTV Cabling.

8.   Visit Branches for technical support any time needed based on advice of line manager.

9.   Record and Register of IT equipment received from Departments and Branches with them receive date, issues and locations.

10.   Record list of repaired devices with full details.

11.   Provide repaired devices to System Section for testing and ensure smooth operation.

12.   Perform repair of IT equipment which are not in functional condition in IT Stock.

13.   Maintain Stock Registry of frequently needed parts of equipment and recommend updates.

14.   Support Head Office and Branch IT Officers with Hardware’s related issues.

15.   Provide Training to IT Staff with Basic Technical Troubleshooting and Technical Knowledge.

16.   Weekly and Monthly report of IT Technician performance covering (items received, items repaired, items serviced or identified unrepairable.

To attend to any other matter that may not have been mentioned in this document but advised by direct line manager or IT manager.

Job Requirements

Educational Qualifications

Baccalaureate (high school diploma) is required, and a bachelor's degree in computer science will be preferred

Experience Required

· Minimum of 2 years of experience in IT support or as an IT technician, with hands-on experience in troubleshooting hardware and software issues.

· Experience in installing, configuring, and maintaining computer hardware, software, and network systems.

· Familiarity with network administration, server maintenance, and technical support in a corporate environment.

Competencies Required

· Proficient in installing, configuring, and maintaining computer systems, network equipment, and peripheral devices (printers, scanners, etc.).

· Strong knowledge of operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux) and productivity software (Microsoft Office Suite, etc.).

· Experience with network troubleshooting, including understanding of TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPNs, and firewall configurations.

· Ability to diagnose and resolve hardware and software issues quickly and effectively.

· Strong understanding of data backup, recovery systems, and IT security practices.

· Ability to support both in-person and remote IT issues, including providing technical support to end-users.

· Good communication skills to provide clear instructions and support to non-technical staff.

· Experience with network cabling and managing IT hardware inventory.

Personal Attributes

· Ensures that technical installations, repairs, and maintenance tasks are completed accurately and    thoroughly.

· Diagnoses and resolves technical issues quickly, minimizing disruption to operations.

· Takes ownership of IT support tasks and ensures systems run smoothly with minimal downtime.

· Keeps up with changing technologies and adapts to new systems, tools, and software.

leadership Capabilities

· Works with other IT team members to resolve complex technical issues and provide high-quality service.

· Assists and trains staff on proper use of IT systems, troubleshooting steps, and software applications.

· Makes informed decisions regarding the best approaches for IT support and system maintenance.

· Identifies potential IT issues before they arise and takes steps to prevent system downtime or disruptions.

description:
About DABS

د افغانستان برشنا شرکت یک شرکت خود کفا و مستقل است که طبق قانون شرکت های سهامی و محدود المسولیت امارت اسلامی افغانستان ایجاد گردیده است. د افغانستان برشنا شرکت با تمام اسهام سرمایه خود یک شرکت محدود المسئولیت بوده که به دولت افغانستان تعلق دارد. شرکت مذکور به تاریخ 15 ثور 1387 مطابق 4 می 2008 به د افغانستان برشنا شرکت تغییر شخصیت نمود و بحیث یک شرکت ملی برق جایگزین د افغانستان برشنا موسسه گردید. د افغانستان برشنا شرکت تولید، تورید، انتقال و توزیع برق را بگونه تجارتی در سراسر افغانستان تنظیم و اداره می نماید.

Job Summary

The Organization Development Officer responsible for organizational effectiveness and growth through the delivery of comprehensive and professional organizational development services reflective of vision and values of DABS.  Also responsible for designing, formatting, and enhancing various official documents, policies, reports, organizational charts, and Employee Affairs forms. The incumbent will support the Employee Affairs Directorate, particularly the Organizational Development Management, in visually presenting documents in a professional and standardized manner that aligns with DABS’s corporate identity

Duties & Responsibilities

Design and format official policies, reports, and presentations using professional templates
Develop visually appealing and standardized Employee Affairs forms, ensuring consistency in design and usability
Create and update organizational charts with accurate structure and branding
Ensure that all designed materials adhere to DABS’s branding guidelines
Maintain uniformity and clarity in all Employee Affairs -related documents
Assist in developing and implementing organization–wide strategies to enhance employee engagement, retention and satisfaction
Assist in reviewing and bringing due changes in Employee Affairs policies, practices, procedures, frameworks and other Employee Affairs related issues
Providing support in conducting and analyzing various surveys and recommending strategies for management intervention
Assist in conducting organization assessment to identify areas for improvement and developing action plans to address them
Translating Employee Affairs related documents from English to Dari & Pashto and vice versa
Carry out any other additional responsibilities as requested by Employee Affairs Director

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in (Graphic Design, Computer Science)
At least 4 years of experience in related field
Experience in applying research methodologies will be given preference

Job Summary

Duties & Responsibilities

He/she will work in close collaboration with the Software Development Department and will fulfill the following duties and responsibilities:

Designing and Development of web and mobile applications.
Conducting feasibility studies for software projects.
Completing tasks such as coding, testing, and debugging.
Writing advanced programming code.
Managing project timelines and tasks.
Work in close partnership with operation, business, and management departments

V. Competencies and Critical Success Factors

Functional Competencies

Knowledge Management and Learning

title: System Administrator
description:
About Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company

Aurum Afghanistan Financial Company is a full-fledged electronic money institution regulated by the central bank of Afghanistan operating under the license No. EMI101006. In addition to our regulatory license, we are also equipped with license No. 78895 from the Ministry of industry and commerce of Afghanistan. We possess advanced technology infrastructure which enables our clients to access financial services through their mobile phones securely, quickly and conveniently. Our services are available to everyone, particularly individuals who may not have access to traditional banking services. We offer significant opportunities for improving the efficiency of digital financial services by expanding access and lowering transaction costs. We provide a customized electronic payment solution. Aurum Afghanistan facilitates digital financial transactions, which includes services such as mobile wallet to mobile wallet, bank 02 to mobile wallet, mobile wallet to bank, electricity and other utilities bill payments, merchant’s payments, AfPay card services, payments through PoS machines and other prospective electronic payments services. AurumPay is a leading electronic money platform in Afghanistan, operating under the supervision of the Central Bank of Afghanistan. We empower individuals, merchants, and corporations with secure, convenient, and innovative financial solutions. Join our mission to bring digital payments to every corner of Afghanistan!

Job Summary

Job Summary

AurumPay EMI is seeking an experienced System Administrator to manage, configure, and maintain our IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate will be responsible for Oracle servers, network security using Sophos firewalls, backup management, and data center setup and operations.

Firewalls

title: Information Comm. Technology Associate, GS6, Fixed Term, Kandahar (#19484) & Herat (#19391)
description:
About UNICEF Afghanistan

UNICEF works in some of the world’s toughest places, to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential. Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone. And we never give up. For every child, Passion!

Job Summary

How can you make a difference? 




Purpose for the job: ICT/T4D Associates will assist programme teams in the identification, assessment and integration of ICT and digital innovation into UNICEF programming; strengthening internal capacity to support T4D related initiatives; identifying and engaging with key partners; building and maintaining business relationships; applying reusable and replicable technical buildings blocks; and maximizing the potential for the scale-up and sustainability of technology and digital innovation for UNICEF programming.







Duties & Responsibilities

Summary of Key function, accountabilities and related duties/tasks

﻿

General ICT/T4D Office Support:
T4D Portfolio Coordination
Minimal ICT Administration

If you would like to know more about this position, please review the complete Job Description here: JD/TOR- ICT Associate G-6




Job Requirements

To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have…




Minimum requirements:

Education:

Completion of Secondary education is required, supplemented with formal training in Computer Science, Information Systems, Telecommunications, Engineering.

Work Experience:

A minimum of six years of practical work experience in information technology, requiring systematic methods of troubleshooting and problem solving is required.
A bachelor’s degree from a recognized academic institution in a relevant field may replace three years of related work experience. A master’s degree may replace an additional two years.
ITIL Foundation Certificate or equivalent customer support certification is an asset. 
Experience in providing assistance to users with IT products and services, and use of applications and diagnostic tools is required.
Practical experience in providing technical and business Customer Support and Services is required.
Practical experience and working knowledge of various computer platforms and applications are required.

Language Requirements: 

Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian or Spanish) or a local language is an asset.

Desirables:

Relevant experience at country level, particularly in development, fragile settings and humanitarian contexts.




Submission Guideline

Remarks:




As per Article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity.

UNICEF is committed to fostering an inclusive, representative, and welcoming workforce. For this position, eligible and suitable Female candidates are encouraged to apply.

Vacancy announcement is open to internal and external candidates. Priority will be given to staff in abolished posts and internal staff members.

Government employees who are considered for employment with UNICEF are normally required to resign from their government positions before taking up an assignment with UNICEF. UNICEF reserves the right to withdraw an offer of appointment, without compensation, if a visa or medical clearance is not obtained, or necessary inoculation requirements are not met, within a reasonable period for any reason. 

UNICEF does not charge a processing fee at any stage of its recruitment, selection, and hiring processes (i.e., application stage, interview stage, validation stage, or appointment and training). UNICEF will not ask for applicants’ bank account information.

Humanitarian action is a cross-cutting priority within UNICEF’s Strategic Plan. UNICEF is committed to stay and deliver in humanitarian contexts. Therefore, all staff, at all levels across all functional areas, can be called upon to be deployed to support humanitarian response, contributing to both strengthening resilience of communities and capacity of national authorities.

All UNICEF positions are advertised, and only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process. An internal candidate performing at the level of the post in the relevant functional area, or an internal/external candidate in the corresponding Talent Group, may be selected, if suitable for the post, without assessment of other candidates.

Candidates who have applied previously do not need to reapply.




Additional information about working for UNICEF can be found here.




Applicants are requested to apply through the provided link; Vacancies | UNICEF Careers




Applications received via JOBS.AF online portal will not be given consideration.
